item.title: Wi-Fi Experiments: From Lab to Campus Networks
item.description:
Wireless Networking (1999)

IEEE 802.11 shipped in 1997. By 1999, Singapore was ahead of the curveâ€”early 802.11b trials at universities. At NTU, we had access to experimental wireless infrastructure. The dream: no wires. Just laptops talking over the air.

Reality: signal was weak, interference constant, range 20 meters on a good day. Tropical humidity killed performance. Water vapor absorbs radio waves. Our tests worked in the lab, then failed in the hallway.
